channel.title: Revolutionary Production Trick
channel.description:
revolutionary for me, anyways
so i had this idea around an hour prior to posting this, and testing revealed better results than i had expected
https://app.auxy.co/projects/q_r8bQXV79B6bemk8DR5lQ==
this is a project with four tracks. the first loops hold the same test melody. the second ones are where i applied the trick.
this idea was born from some boring sound science about overtones. how the trick itself works is that the melody is raised by an octave, and then a perfect fifth above that (13 and 7 spaces in a chromatic loop respectively). the effect, with most sounds, is the instrument sounding more “shimmery,” for lack of a better term, demonstrated in the Corn loop. for some reason, certain sounds don’t work with the trick, as shown in the Owl loop. some sounds, the two i found being Gravel and Stress, react strangely to the trick, producing new sounds entirely.
hopefully this information is useful to you, or even comes up in your tracks.

item.title: Revolutionary Production Trick
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I’ve been using Stress like that for a while. Turns a good sound into an even more interesting sound.
Maxing out the Tone on Stress results in (what seems like) self-modulation, producing something akin to a ‘metalizer + distortion’ effect.

Keep in mind that the sounds were likely designed to offer these possibilities.

 
Btw, good loop.
